area_name: Raven Rocks North Face "Power Block" Area

content.description:
Shares the same start as

Red Devil

(5.12b).

Boulder start (or jump for a jug) underneath the roof, climb huecos until you reach a sloper undercling, From here reach the well-chalked jug and a fingerlock, pull the lip and stand up to a small undercling, reach up to the bigger undercling and then go left to good holds.

This is essentially where you leave

Red Devil

, moving left entails some strenuous core movement, continue up and left with balancy lieback moves to another fingerlock and twistlock into a good flake, move right to crimpers until you can reach the leftmost sidepull of

Red Devil

, creep upwards on the occasional good hold and a bunch of nothing to the anchor.

A better route than

Red Devil

. A bit longer with much better movement, plus you have to do the best/crux moves of both routes.
content.protection: 4 chain draws, 1 hanger to 2 chains with wiregate carabiners at the anchor.
content.location:
Left of

Espresso

in the middle of the roof

content.description: Though incredibly short this is a fun route with limited hands and feet and requires good balance. The first bolt is high up and while the clipping position is solid, it would certainly hurt to take a spill from there.
content.location: To the left of tough choices.

content.description:
This is the route just left of

Red Devil

(5.12b). A hard move getting past the second bolt, tricky climbing to the boulder crux at the top. This was the first 5.13 route bolted at NJC.

Voodoo Child is a traversing, link-up route that starts to the left of Disconnected and just right of the chimney start of Balancing Act. Stick clip the 1st bolt and boulder start left of it, traverse past another bolt. Clip the third bolt on Disconnected and do the hard traversing crux of it. Keep traversing and clip a brown bolt between Disconnected and

Voodoo Lounge

. Clip the last bolt on

Voodoo Lounge

and do the crux of that route and finish on it's anchors.
Short route with a bouldery start and balance-dependent crux. Well protected and a sweet little route to climb if you're looking to get a quick one in with dwindling daylight.
content.location: Last route on the Raven Rocks North area.

content.description:
Starts on the large boulder right of

Espresso

, crimpy face climbing up the face of the boulder mantel on to the top of the boulder then, bridge across the gap between the boulder and the adjoining face. More enjoyable climbing up the face on good edges to the anchor.
content.location: Starts on the large boulder right of Espresso

content.description:
Boulder start (or jump for a jug) underneath the roof, climb huecos until you reach a sloper undercling, from here reach the well chalked jug and a fingerlock, Crux is pulling the lip and standing up to an undercling. Above you'll find varied moves on crimpers and jugs. The route uses the first 2 chain draws (the remaining chain draws up and left belong to the route "

You don't know Jack

").
content.protection:
Chain Anchors, 2 chain draws (the remaining chain draws up and left belong to the route "

You don't know Jack

"). 3 hangers for draws.
content.location:
In the middle of the roof left of

Espresso

(5.10c).

content.description: One of the longest routes on the North wall.  Crux found coming out of large hole/hueco.  Well protected.
content.protection: 9 bolts to shut anchors.  Rap  down.
content.location:
Route starts between two formations on the right side in front of a bush.  Start just right of Holy Moly (which has large huecos and is an area classic)

Southern CA sport climbing guide route # 870

content.description:
Start just left of

The Raven

, below a series of huecos on the blunt arete. Climb the steep huecos past 3 bolts to a ledge, continue up to a short left facing corner and into the lower angle ramp/large hueco. Step up and left onto a small ledge and then back right to a horozontal dike with some large crystals. climb onto the dike(crux) and face climb up, slightly right at the bulge then back left to the anchor. Extending with longer draws the 4th and 6th(chicken bolts) will help with rope drag on this long route.
Short well protected and fun.  Crux is between 1st & 2nd bolt.
content.location:
Just right of large roof - big square flake at second bolt.  Rap down.

Southern CA sport climbing guide - route # 865

content.description: Left of Voodoo Lounge, with a bouldery start and a hard traversing crux finished by a long throw to a "jug". Long moves, good holds and crappy footholds this route is tricky.
content.location: Left of Voodoo Lounge right of the start of Voodoo Child

content.description: Go up the dihedral with opportunities for hand and finger jams.
content.location: Right of Espresso, left of the corridor.

content.description: Blast From The Past starts just left of Holey Moley. Climb the slab just left of the chimney to a bolt 15' up (long draw) cross over the chimney to the right and climb just left of Holey Moley and then start traversing left. Turn the bulge and climb the well protected, thin lower angle face (Blast From The Past) to the anchor on the red headwall. Escaping left or right past the last two bolts is strictly off route. This is a good route that sees very little traffic, usually no chalk.

This route is right of Do What on the boulder face right of Espresso.  This route has an unfortunate tale.  I bolted and FA'd this line with a clean passage up and right of the obvious "hole" that is the right border of Do What.  Several people (as in 10+) climbed it the day it was FA'd, all good and smiles.  The line was completely independent of Do What and was a fun cruiser route.

Evidently a few months later, persons who shall remain nameless, decided that the line at the singular point near the hole was close enough that the possibility of someone grabbing the right side of the hole was just too much for them to take.  As a result, the lines first couple of bolts were artificially forced right away from the natural line and the now "RepoMan" was created.  It still shares the same top few bolts and anchors as the original Babes, but is instead a contrived route of low quality.

Sometimes it is too bad when people can't leave others work alone.
content.location: Just right of Do What.  Ends at the top of the boulder with Fixe quick clip anchors.

pathTokens: Raven Rocks North Face "Power Block" Area
